perturbation.original_text:
5. PAYMENT.
5.1 ADVERTISING FEES.  After the Launch Date,
i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based
on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising
fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry
amount calculated by multiplying 0.025% by
the amount of the average Transaction from
all Customers in the preceding quarter. The
formula for arriving at the per Transaction
Inquiry amount may be revised from time to
time during the term of this Agreement to
reflect present market conditions ("the
Adjusted Rate"), but only by mutual
consent of the parties after good faith discussions.
The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an
addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5. PAYMENT.
5.1 ADVERTISING FEES.  After the Launch Date,
i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based
on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising
fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry
amount. The
formula for arriving at the per Transaction
Inquiry amount may be revised from time to
time during the term of this Agreement to
reflect present market conditions ("the
Adjusted Rate"), but only by mutual
consent of the parties after good faith discussions.
The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an
addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific formula for calculating the advertising fees based on Transaction Inquiries, the contract now vaguely states that the advertising fee will be based on a 'per Transaction Inquiry amount' but provides no initial calculation. This creates an ambiguity and potential for disputes because the initial basis for the fee calculation is undefined. Later sections that mention payment are now referencing something not clearly defined.

perturbation.original_text:
1. DEFINITIONS.
(b) "CO-BRANDED SITE" means the web-site accessible through
Domain Name, for the Services implemented by i-Escrow. The
homepage of this web-site will visibly display both
2TheMart Marks and i-Escrow Marks.
(d) "DOMAIN NAME" means www.iescrow.com/2TheMart.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. DEFINITIONS.
(b) "CO-BRANDED SITE" means the web-site accessible through
Domain Name, for the Services implemented by i-Escrow. The
homepage of this web-site will visibly display both
2TheMart Marks and i-Escrow Marks.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the definition of 'Domain Name,' the contract now references a term without explicitly stating what it is. While it can be inferred from context, the omission introduces ambiguity. Later sections referencing the 'Domain Name' for purposes of trademark restrictions and enforcement actions are now less clear because its primary definition is missing.

perturbation.original_text:
8.2 TERMINATION FOR BREACH.  In addition to other remedies that
may be available to it, by providing written notice, a party
may immediately terminate this Agreement: (a) if the other party
materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure that
breach within sixty (60) days after receiving written
notice of the breach, or (b) as provided in Sections 2.2  [INITIAL INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM DEVELOPMENT],
2.4  [RESTRICTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS], or 12.4.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.2 TERMINATION FOR BREACH.  In addition to other remedies that
may be available to it, by providing written notice, a party
may immediately terminate this Agreement: (a) if the other party
materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure that
breach within sixty (60) days after receiving written
notice of the breach, or (b) as provided in Sections 2.2  [INITIAL INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM DEVELOPMENT],
2.4  [RESTRICTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS].
perturbation.explanation: By removing reference to 'Section 12.4' within termination of breach, the force majeure event detailed is unreferenced. This generates uncertainty because force majeure events are unconsidered.
